Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First the task is to identify cases with performance issues I need to look at the event log and calculate the duration for each case The duration is from the first event Submit Claim to the last event Close Claim

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Let me list out the cases and their timestamps Case 2001 Submit 20240401 0900 Close 20240401 1030 Duration From 0900 to 1030 on the same day 15 hours Case 2002 Submit 20240401 0905 Close 20240402 1100 Duration From 0905 on 0401 to 1100 on 0402 About 25 hours 55 minutes roughly 1 day and 2 hours Case 2003 Submit 20240401 0910 Close 20240403 0930 Duration From 0910 on 0401 to 0930 on 0403 About 48 hours 20 minutes 2 days Case 2004 Submit 20240401 0920 Close 20240401 1045 Duration From 0920 to 1045 on the same day 1 hour 25 minutes Case 2005 Submit 20240401 0925 Close 20240404 1430 Duration From 0925 on 0401 to 1430 on 0404 About 77 hours 5 minutes 3 days and 5 hours

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So comparing durations 2001 15 hours 2002 26 hours 2003 48 hours 2004 15 hours 2005 77 hours Cases with significantly longer durations are 2002 2003 and especially 2005 Lets say anything over 24 hours is a performance issue

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Next analyze attributes Resource Region Complexity

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Attributes for each case 2001 Region A Complexity Low 2002 Region B Complexity Medium 2003 Region A Complexity High 2004 Region B Complexity Low 2005 Region B Complexity High

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now look for correlations Region Cases in Region B 2002 and 2005 have longer durations while 2004 in Region B is short 2003 in Region A is long so not just Region B

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Complexity Low complexity cases 2001 2004 are short Medium 2002 is medium duration High 2003 2005 are long So high complexity seems to correlate with longer durations

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Resources Lets see who handled them AdjusterLisa is in 2002 2004 2005 2002 and 2005 are long but 2004 is short AdjusterMike in 2001 short and 2003 long So not clearly tied to one resource

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: However for long cases 2002 has AdjusterLisa 2003 has AdjusterMike 2005 has AdjusterLisa ManagerBill is in 2003 and 2005 long cases while ManagerAnn is in 2001 2002 2004 mixed Perhaps ManagerBill is slower

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Also notice in the log Cases with Request Additional Documents take longer because they add delays 2002 One request 2003 Two requests 2005 Three requests 2001 and 2004 No requests

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: High complexity cases have multiple requests leading to delays

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Root causes High Complexity Requires more documents hence more requests and time Region Region B might have delays in processing requests Resources Possibly ManagerBill takes longer to approve

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Propose explanations and suggestions Explanations Highcomplexity claims need more verification leading to multiple document requests and longer wait times Certain resources like AdjusterLisa or ManagerBill might be overburdened or less efficient Region B could have procedural delays or resource shortages

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Suggestions For highcomplexity claims Implement automated document checks or prioritize them with dedicated teams For resources Train staff or redistribute workload to avoid bottlenecks For regions Standardize processes across regions or provide additional support to lagging regions

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Structure the response 1 Identify cases List 2002 2003 2005 as having performance issues 2 Analyze attributes Discuss correlations 3 Propose explanations and suggestions
